TITLE: 5 money-saving tips from a TikTok lawyer who reads the fine print
SUMMARY: Reading the fine print means you could save money, according to Erika Kullberg, lawyer and founder of Plug and Law.

TITLE: Big food automation is making its way to Main Street's menu
SUMMARY: From restaurants to packaged food makers, software automation and robots are beginning to play a bigger role in small business economic decisions.

TITLE: Main Street's minority owners need loans to grow, but access to capital remains inequitable
SUMMARY: Black-owned small businesses are growing, and can tap SBA loans, but access to capital from banks is a hurdle and securing banking relationships is critical.

TITLE: How this mechanic found a niche fixing Teslas and EVs
SUMMARY: Carl Medlock used to work at Tesla, now he runs his own repair shop in Seattle fixing electric vehicles.

TITLE: The congressional spending bill battle had a not-so-great message for small businesses
SUMMARY: A majority of small business owners support more relief from the government, according to the CNBC|SurveyMonkey Small Business Survey. Don't count on it.

TITLE: The 30-year-old female founder at the forefront of a billion-dollar bet on CRISPR gene editing
SUMMARY: Nathan Chen’s sister Janice co-founded Mammoth Biosciences while watching her brother skate in the Olympics. Her plan: get the CRISPR start-up to $100 billion.

TITLE: Here’s how urban and rural Americans build wealth differently
SUMMARY: There are key differences between rural and urban Americans when it comes to building wealth. Here's how it may affect retirement.

TITLE: These are 5 common challenges every entrepreneur faces — here's how to prepare for them
SUMMARY: A successful entrepreneur must have a playbook for how to scale their business, according to Zuleyka Strasner, founder and CEO of Zero Grocery.

TITLE: Closing the gender gap for women-led businesses could boost global GDP by $2 trillion, Citi says
SUMMARY: Women receive a small fraction of VC funding and closing the investment gender gap could drive economic growth, according to a new report from Citigroup.

TITLE: Next to the last steel mill in town, a robotic farm grows backed by Pritzker billions
SUMMARY: Fifth Season, a vertical farming upstart in the heart of steel country is hoping that it can come to play a big role in a new era of urban-based agriculture.

TITLE: Chicago Fed's Charles Evans cautions on inflation's hit to small businesses
SUMMARY: Even with average earnings flattening out in February, Evans said he hears from smaller companies about the challenges from cost increases.

TITLE: Big February job growth for economy, but on Main Street it's still a struggle to find workers
SUMMARY: While job gains are being seen across the U.S., small business owners say that the hiring environment is not getting better and it's hard to find good workers.

TITLE: Why Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger was a guest at President Biden's State of the Union address
SUMMARY: Intel's CEO Pat Gelsinger is choosing big domestic chip manufacturing investments over short-term shareholder rewards, and he has a big fan: President Biden.

TITLE: Ahead of State of the Union address, President Biden's approval with Main Street is underwater
SUMMARY: President Biden is expected to highlight economic strength but also discuss inflation in his State of the Union address. Main Street will be listening.

TITLE: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal says without Lebron James, the Lakers will never win again
SUMMARY: Some have suggested that trading James may be the quickest and easiest way to fix the team's disconnect.

TITLE: This university-led accelerator is funding diverse start-ups in St. Louis
SUMMARY: The University of Missouri-St. Louis Business School's DEI accelerator is taking a new approach to funding start-ups and creating generational wealth.

TITLE: Did you start your own business in 2021? Here's what you need to know before filing your taxes
SUMMARY: "Do not do this on your own," said Adam Markowitz, an enrolled agent and vice president at Howard L Markowitz PA, CPA in Leesburg, Florida.

TITLE: Black upward mobility strongest in diverse neighborhoods with mentorship opportunities, says Census Bureau
SUMMARY: Many African-Americans face an uphill battle when it comes to building wealth. A small group of neighborhoods and entrepreneurs are bucking this trend.

TITLE: On Main Street, the need to take on more debt is rising with inflation
SUMMARY: Taking out loans as a small business isn't easy, but supply chain, inflation and wage issues are making more on Main Street look to debt as Covid relief ends.

TITLE: This entrepreneur raised $16.5 million for an eco-friendly grocery startup. Here are her five golden rules for achieving success
SUMMARY: A successful entrepreneur needs dedication and should be "armed with information," according to Zuleyka Strasner, founder and CEO of Zero Grocery.

TITLE: What to know about filing a 2021 income tax return if you own a business
SUMMARY: Some Covid tax relief has expired for the 2021 income tax filing season, but not all, and Main Street has been spared Build Back Better tax proposals.

TITLE: Fed up with the rise in thefts and shoplifting, small-biz owners across U.S. are taking action
SUMMARY: Some small-business owners tell CNBC a rise in theft is devastating to their business, especially now, with many still recovering from a global pandemic.

TITLE: Restaurateur says he spends around $750,000 on security to deal with unruly diners
SUMMARY: "It's difficult for managers," on top of short staffing as well as rising costs and supply chain issues, Cameron Mitchell told CNBC on Wednesday.

TITLE: 'You can't just sit still.' Inflation has slammed small businesses. Here's how one entrepreneur fought back
SUMMARY: Small businesses that survived the first year of the pandemic soon found a new challenge with rising inflation.

TITLE: Main Street restaurant owners growing through the pandemic
SUMMARY: Near 90,000 restaurants have shuttered during the pandemic, and sales may not be back to pre-Covid levels for a year. But some owners are growing.

TITLE: A new inflation reading shows the small business tipping point has been reached
SUMMARY: More small business owners say they need to raise prices and don't expect inflation to decline, a signal that higher prices have overtaken Main Street.

TITLE: More Covid relief for small businesses? Struggling industries hope that’s the case
SUMMARY: The omicron surge hit industries that had already struggled through the pandemic. Now some, including gyms, hotels and restaurants, are pushing for more relief.

TITLE: Shock then relief: An Arkansas theater says its denied Covid relief grant was overturned
SUMMARY: The Studio Theatre was initially denied a grant by the SBA in July 2021 because it does not pay its performers.

TITLE: Atlanta is a growing hub for top tech companies like Apple and Microsoft to find Black talent
SUMMARY: Apple, Alphabet, Microsoft and Visa are among the West Coast companies opening offices in the city.

TITLE: ‘I didn't want to wait any longer.’ Meet three entrepreneurs who quit during the 'Great Resignation' to start their own businesses
SUMMARY: A record 5.4 million people filed new business applications last year. Here's how three people struck out on their own.
